newsitem.title: UK: Hyder shares gain after H1 results.
newsitem.headline: Hyder shares gain after H1 results.

text.p: Shares in Hyder Plc rose in early trade on Friday after the company posted a rise in first-half profits and said recently-acquired electricity business Swalec should be earnings enhancing in the full year.
The stock was up 7-1/2p at 749-1/2 by 0834 GMT.
Pre-tax profit rose to 100.7 million stg in the six months ended Sept 30 from 80.6 million stg a year before. Analysts had expected profits of between 96 million stg and 109 million.
Hyder said its acquisition of Swalec "should be materially earnings enhancing on a full-year basis."

It said its Hyder Services unit was already living up to its expectations while other non-regulated activities had improved this year, "with notable achievements in our infrastructure investment and consulting businesses."
"By any objective measure these are excellent results," said chairman Iain Evans.
